com.jakubpetriska.gameengine.api

Class MeshData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jakubpetriska.gameengine.api.MeshData

  • public class MeshData
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains data about vertices, faces and normals of mesh. Mesh data are read-only. Any change to any of the fields will not result in any change in the rendered mesh. Also for one model there exists only one instance of MeshData. Never create this class directly. You should not need to create your own instances of MeshData. Creation of custom meshes through code is currently not supported.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float[] normals
      Contains coordinates of normals in this mesh.
      int[] trianglesNormals
      Contains indices of normals of vertices of triangles in this mesh.
      int[] trianglesVertices
      Contains indices of vertices of triangles in this mesh.
      float[] vertices
      Contains coordinates of vertices in this mesh.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MeshData(float[] vertices, float[] normals, int[] trianglesVertices, int[] trianglesNormals)
      Never use this directly.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • vertices

        public final float[] vertices
        Contains coordinates of vertices in this mesh. Every vertex has 3 coordinates.

      • normals

        public final float[] normals
        Contains coordinates of normals in this mesh. Every normal has 3 coordinates.

      • trianglesVertices

        public final int[] trianglesVertices
        Contains indices of vertices of triangles in this mesh.

      • trianglesNormals

        public final int[] trianglesNormals
        Contains indices of normals of vertices of triangles in this mesh. Must be the same length as trianglesVertices. Meshes without normals are currently not supported.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MeshData

        public MeshData(float[] vertices,
                float[] normals,
                int[] trianglesVertices,
                int[] trianglesNormals)
        Never use this directly.
